snippet: New evidence on screening tests is disturbing. The tests provide no gain, but can lead to harmful surgeries and complications.
abstract: Editorial contends new evidence provided by the United States Preventive Services Task Force that shows women are more likely to be harmed than helped by screening tests for ovarian cancer is disturbing; calls for both doctors and their patients to recognize that the assumption that such screenings can save lives is wrong.
lead_paragraph: New evidence on screening tests is disturbing. The tests provide no gain, but can lead to harmful surgeries and complications.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations
